title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: We mounted our ponies a little after three, and rode down Glen Mark, stopping to drink some water out of a very pure well, called The White Well ; and crossing the Mark several times.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: little time Alice and I remounted our ponies, (Albert riding some part of the time,) and turned to the left, when we came in sight of a new country, and looked down a very fine glen — Glen Mark.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: We mounted our ponies a little after three, androde doAvn Glen Mark, stopping to drink someAvater out of a very pure well, called The WhiteWell, and crossing the Mark several times.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: After walking some little time Alice and Iremounted our ponies (Albert riding some partof the time) and turned to the left, when we camein sight of a new country, and looked down a veryfine glen — Glen Mark.

title: The history of a man.
author: Gilfillan, George
snippet: I was still more struck with the opening up of a glen, called Glen Mark, or Murk — "the dark^leu."
